org.j3d.opengl.swt.draw2d
Class GLFigure

java.lang.Object
  Figure
      org.j3d.opengl.swt.draw2d.GLFigure
public class GLFigure
extends Figure

A lightweight that represents a surface that OpenGL draws into.

Drawable Management

The canvas automatically creates a GLDrawable object to correspond to this canvas, and an accompanying GLContext instance. The GLContext instance, by default is synchronized. It also has several other properties that are a little non-standard.

In order to be as widely usable as possible, we don't guarantee that the rendering is backed by a Pbuffer, frame buffer object or anything else. We try to use, in order, FBO, Pbuffer and finally an ordinary offscreen drawable object. Thus, the drawable that you can request from this surface is a generic wrapper object that hides which of these renderables we've ended up using under the covers.

This drawable wrapper acts just like any other drawable with one exception. You can create others using shared contexts, add listeners, call repaint and so forth. We however, will not let you resize it. The size of the drawable is directly linked to the size of this figure. As the figure changes size, we resize the underlying drawable to match. There are many reasons we need to do this, including handling such this as driver bugs and managing the repaint timing. Calling the setSize() method is silently ignored.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Justin Couch

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The device instance was null

                GLContext sharedWith)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a new isntance of this widget

Parameters:
device - The screen device context that holds the parent component. Must not be null
sharedWith - The GL context to share resources with. May be null

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The device instance was null

GLFigure

public GLFigure(Display device,
                GLCapabilities capabilities,
                GLCapabilitiesChooser chooser,
                GLContext sharedWith)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a new instance of this widget. The capabilities are defined from the list of prefered options in the chooser. If no chooser is given, a default implementation is used that picks the best option.

Parameters:
device - The screen device context that holds the parent component. Must not be null
capabilities - A selection of the requested capabilities
chooser - A chooser to help decide between requested and available screen and device capabilities
sharedWith - The GL context to share resources with. May be null
Method Detail

setBounds

public void setBounds(Rectangle r)
Change the sige of this figure to the new dimensions. Subclasses that override this method should make sure it is called so that we can resize the OpenGL information appropriately.

Parameters:
r - The rectangle representing the bounds

setSize

public void setSize(int w,
                    int h)
Change the sige of this figure to the new dimensions. Subclasses that override this method should make sure it is called so that we can resize the OpenGL information appropriately.

Parameters:
w - The new width to use
h - The new height to use

paintFigure

public void paintFigure(Graphics g)
Paint the contents of this figure now.

setOpaque

public void setOpaque(boolean opaque)

addNotify

public void addNotify()
Overridden to track when this component is added to the parent figure and hence may be able to start up OpenGL state. Subclasses which override this method must call super.addNotify() in their addNotify() method in order to function properly.

removeNotify

public void removeNotify()
Overridden to track when this component is removed from the parent figure and hence may be able to throw away OpenGL state. Subclasses which override this method must call super.removeNotify() in their removeNotify() method in order to function properly.

getDisplay

public Display getDisplay()
Fetch the device that this figure was created on. Useful for when you are doing manual drawing and need to asynchronously schedule repaint events onto the surface.

Returns:
The device instance this was created with

isZeroSized

public boolean isZeroSized()
Convenience method to see if it is worth attempting to draw to this image, even when it is visible. Basically it checks the size of the figure and if is non-zero in both dimensions.

Returns:
true if it is worthwhile attempting to draw to this figure

addGLFigureSizeListener

public void addGLFigureSizeListener(GLFigureSizeListener l)
Add a new listener for size. If the listener is already added, it is ignored. A value of null is ignored.

Parameters:
l - The listener instance to add

removeGLFigureSizeListener

public void removeGLFigureSizeListener(GLFigureSizeListener l)
Remove an existing listener for size. If the listener is not added, the request is silently ignored. A value of null is ignored.

Parameters:
l - The listener instance to add

getGLContext

public GLContext getGLContext()
Get the GLContext instance that was created for this figure instance.

Returns:
The current context

getGLAutoDrawable

public GLAutoDrawable getGLAutoDrawable()
Get the drawable instance that was created for this figure instance. This drawable will be a pbuffer that the underlying system renders to if hardware support for pbuffers is available, otherwise an offscreen renderable is used.

Returns:
The current context

setManualDrawing

public void setManualDrawing(boolean enable)
Notification that you wish to do your own manual context management and buffer swapping.

If you are going to do your own context management rather than using the GLEventListener registered to the pbuffer, you will need to also make sure that you call swapBuffers() on this figure so that the contents of the underlying pbuffer is read in.

isManualDrawing

public boolean isManualDrawing()
Check to see if manual drawing is being done.
